TEI.2.document_title: Jared E. Groce to Stephen F. Austin, 11-06-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 933

div1.p: I promised to Select a Track of Land for Doct. Keep and one for Thomas Purvis and Capt. Brown and for the Randols. But in consequence of my Bad health and other Misfortunes I shall not be able to attend to it and must request you to make the selections for them, as to my Own Business I Leave it to yourself and J. P. Coles to decide on it as you may Think proper which will be satisfactory to me I have Explaind my self to Coles—whom will Explain to you I am in Bad helth But something on the mend
[Addressed:] Col. S F Austin Political chief and Jud of the Colony J. P. Coles
